intro: Reichantha demissa, commonly known as the narrowleaf reichantha, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in open areas such as prairies and woodland edges. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Reichantha demissa is also known for its aromatic properties, which can be released when the leaves are crushed.
